comment.narrative: 1- Supported provided to International Women’s Day Celebration in 6 provinces and in Kabul 2-Equipment is procured for WACs and the recruitment is at the interview stage 3- 16 cadres are attending their classes at UMEF N-Peace members implemented their action plans in 2 target provinces supporting 558 DoWA staff, community members, religious leaders and school staff at Nangarhar and Herat regions on peace building process 4- N-Peace members implemented their action plans in 2 target provinces supporting 558 DoWA staff, community members, religious leaders and school staff at Nangarhar and Herat regions on peace building process

3.1. Conduct one campaign public media.
3.2. 50 Cases resolved through resolved by LHCs/WACs through institutionalized referral mechanism.
3.3. Support 16 government official complete the fourth and final semester's in degree programme in public law gender.

3.1. The legislative process and legislative agenda of the government enhanced from the gender equality perspective.Level of compliance of laws with gender equality principles in increased Targeted laws were already reviewed by other agencies. UNAMA annually reviews EVAW cases, hence GEP II avoided duplicating efforts.
3.2. Capacity of MoWA for influencing the finalization and monitoring of laws affecting women such as the Family Law, application of the marriage certificate among others improved.Media advocacy and awareness raising activities were organized. Public campaigns on Elimination of Violence Against Women reached almost 44,893 people. DoWA magazine in Herat was published and distributed among 1,500 men and women.
3.3 MOWA Training and Advocacy Department (TAD) capacity improved to support gender, justice and human rights awareness/education activities.

comment.narrative: 1-With the joint venture of MAIL, FAO, WFP, SDU/UNDP and GEP-II efforts were geared to establish production cum demonstration centers. . 80 women beneficiaries have been provided with the agricultural land by MAIL with the technical support of SDU and GEP-II of UNDP and MAIL. 2- 9 BDS packages are in the process of development and project started strengthening the capacity of 10 women managed cooperatives 3- Govt. partners (MAIL, DAIL and DoWA) and UNDP /SDU have been mobilized to strengthen 9 women cooperative 4- established PWDCs strengthened identify, advocate for and monitor impact of interventions

2.1. Implement Two Women Income Generation Activities.
2.2. Provide on BDS Package to Women Entrepreneurs.

2.1. Twelve business development packages (BDS) were developed and provided to 108 business enterprises from Balkh, Bamyan, Herat and Nangarhar in 2014 in partnership with two local NGOs.
2.2. New clean technologies were introduced; 47 women in Balkh, 16 in Nangarhar – food processing and 100 in Kabul - farming. Solar drying systems and trainings were provided; Irrigation system and energy saving clean machines were provided at Pilawary farm in Kabul.
